meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp movement or jerk.
meanings.sent1: The cat made a quick tolts and pounced on the toy.
meanings.sent2: I felt a tolts in my arm when I lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The tolts of the car hitting a pothole made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The sudden tolts of the earthquake shook the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's tolts across the stage were graceful and precise.

meanings.definition: To move or cause to move with a sudden, sharp movement.
meanings.sent1: She tolts the ball towards the goal with great force.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to tolts the fragile vase.
meanings.sent3: He tolts the door open, surprising his friends inside.
meanings.sent4: The wind tolts the leaves off the tree in a gentle dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef tolts the pan to flip the pancake effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A quick, sudden action or movement.
meanings.sent1: The sudden tolts of the crowd rushing towards the stage were overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: His tolts to finish the race first were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The tolts of the squirrel stealing the nut were comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The tolts of the basketball player were swift and skillful.
meanings.sent5: The tolts of the thunderstorm approaching could be heard in the distance.
